element.name: The Inexorable Search by anacreon, Unknown Cache (2.5/1)
element.description: Geocache for Samuel Beckett Bridge, opened December 2009. This cache is not at the given coordinates; to find it you must solve the puzzle below.

long-description.p: The Samuel Beckett Bridge is the second river crossing of the Liffey from the Irish Sea. It was designed by Santiago Calatrava, who also worked on the James Joyce Bridge further upstream. The bridge itself was floated into position in May 2009, and opened to traffic in December 2009.
The coordinates are hidden within the clues below. How you solve them is up to you.

Temporary adjustment: the cache has moved a short distance from the above puzzle location. Until I re-create the puzzle images, take the above solution and add 0.005 north, 0.073 west. Send a message if you'd like confirmation of the final location.
This is my first geocache; do let me know what you think (too hard, too easy, too specialised...)
Geochecker link is unnecessary; if you're not certain, then you don't have the answer.
The cache is a micro container. There's no need to fall into the river; the cache is safely reachable without going too close to the water's edge.

ul.li:
2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by lenik1
Found it during a walk through the city centre. TFTC

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Sally&eL
19:17 #590
Easy find.
TFTC

2010-04-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by dickedick
My first irish-cache found. TFTC Dickedick from Sweden

2010-04-10T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by ISU400m
Well, without a GPS, it was rather difficult to find. Especially since we didn't know what we were looking for. Oh well, maybe next time we're in Ireland.

2010-04-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by dottigross
Nice puzzle ;-)
TFTC dottigross from Germany

2010-03-05T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Just love this bridge, so apt for Ireland. Found with EdwardsClan on his visit here. Started looking in the original location before reading some more and adjusting for the move! As for the initial clue, it was eating a millfiore that helped me solve it...

wpt.name: GC1TV9X
wpt.desc: The Inexorable Search by anacreon, Unknown Cache (2.5/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: The Inexorable Search
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Geocache for Samuel Beckett Bridge, opened December 2009. This cache is not at the given coordinates; to find it you must solve the puzzle below.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The Samuel Beckett Bridge is the second river crossing of the Liffey from the Irish Sea. It was designed by Santiago Calatrava, who also worked on the James Joyce Bridge further upstream. The bridge itself was floated into position in May 2009, and opened to traffic in December 2009.

The coordinates are hidden within the clues below. How you solve them is up to you.

Temporary adjustment: the cache has moved a short distance from the above puzzle location. Until I re-create the puzzle images, take the above solution and add 0.005 north, 0.073 west. Send a message if you'd like confirmation of the final location.

This is my first geocache; do let me know what you think (too hard, too easy, too specialised...)

Geochecker link is unnecessary; if you're not certain, then you don't have the answer.

The cache is a micro container. There's no need to fall into the river; the cache is safely reachable without going too close to the water's edge.

Additional Waypoints

My first irish-cache found. TFTC Dickedick from Sweden
Well, without a GPS, it was rather difficult to find. Especially since we didn't know what we were looking for. Oh well, maybe next time we're in Ireland.

Nice puzzle ;-)
TFTC dottigross from Germany

Just love this bridge, so apt for Ireland. Found with EdwardsClan on his visit here. Started looking in the original location before reading some more and adjusting for the move! As for the initial clue, it was eating a millfiore that helped me solve it...
